commitResults.messageTitle: merge to allow A-Packages to have gradle support
A-CodingStandard: Tweak the code to comply with a coding standard
Level 9: Give users a way to find a task
A-CheckStyle: Use checkStyle to detect coding style violations
Level-10: Use the JavaFX technology to implement the GUI
A-Assertions: Add runtime asserts to document critical assumptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Several code paths rely on invariants that are not explicitly stated.
When those invariants are violated, failures surface later and in less
relevant code, making diagnosis harder.

Important assumptions should be visible where they matter, so readers can
judge whether the control flow and state transitions are safe without
tracing every caller.

Let's add Java assert statements at key points to document invariants and
fail fast when they do not hold.

Asserts are preferable here because they express programmer intent,
provide optional runtime verification, and avoid turning internal
invariants into test-only checks or production exceptions.

commitResults.messageTitle: A-CodeQuality: Refactor parsing and storage handling to improve code quality
commitResults.messageBody:
Logic is duplicated across various methods and parsing failures can
surface as avoidable runtime errors.

These issues make the code harder to understand and maintain and can
make it harder to trace errors in code.

Let's improve code quality by using methods to handle repeated logic and
by making long methods smaller using helper methods.

This keeps behavior consistent while reducing duplication and making the
code easier to read while handling errors better.
A-Assertions: Add runtime asserts to document critical assumptions

commitResults.messageTitle: BCD-Extension: Add help for valid commands
commitResults.messageBody:
Users have no way to discover available commands or the expected input
formats unless they make an invalid command.

Lack of help makes the app harder to use and increases the chance of
invalid inputs especially for date/time fields.

Let's introduce a help command that displays a help page listing all
supported commands along with the appropriate formats.

This approach keeps the guidance close to the command interface without
requiring external documentation.

A-Assertions: Add asserts for critical assumptions

branch-BCD-Extension contains completed BCD extension work that is ready
to be integrated into the main development line.

Not merging prevents the help feature from being used.

Let's merge branch-BCD-Extension to consolidate the extension changes in
one place and enable testing and further development on top of them.

Public classes and methods have incomplete or inconsistent Javadocs.

The lack of documentation makes it harder to understand what classes and
methods do.

Let's use AI to update the Javadocs for all classes and methods to
clarify what they do as well as what their parameters are and what
they return.

Using AI assistance produces consistent documentation while getting it
done quickly.

The AI used is ChatGPT.

README does not contain information to help users use the application.

A User Guide helps to inform users of the features of the application
and how to use it.

Let's add a User Guide to the README.md file to help new users learn
how to use the application.

The User Guide will also be displayed on GitHub.

User Guide has formatting errors.

A User Guide helps to inform users of the features of the application
and how to use it.

Let's edit the User Guide so it displays properly to let users learn
how to use the application.

The User Guide will also be displayed on GitHub.

Build gradle does not point to the correct launcher.

Pointing to the correct launcher file allows the application to launch.

Let's update build gradle so that main class is set to the correct
launcher.

This helps the JAR file work properly.
